hints.content:
There are $3$ circles.  $\dfrac{1}{4}$ of each circle is shaded.

![The same circles with each section labeled 1 fourth.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/33c2703fbcc761aee50137f23746a1aab3ccc652)
We can find the shaded area by adding $\dfrac14 + \dfrac14 + \dfrac14$ .
We can also find the shaded area by multiplying $3 \times \dfrac14$ .

We can calculate the shaded area using the following expressions:

* $\dfrac{1}{4} + \dfrac{1}{4} + \dfrac{1}{4}$

* $3 \times \dfrac{1}{4}$
